author: Martin MacMahon
title: Two thirds of Canadians support legalization of pot: poll
text:
Summary Sixty-five per cent of those asked say pot legalization makes sense
VANCOUVER (NEWS 1130) – Two in three Canadians would like to see marijuana legalized, according to a new survey.
This comes as pot policy has been a major talking point ahead of this month’s election.
Sixty-five per cent of those polled by Insights West say green-lighting pot legalization makes sense. That even includes a significant chunk of people who have never smoked up.
“They’re really looking at the situation almost in the same way that you look at taxes and gambling. Even if you’re not gambling… you still see some benefits from having other people spend their money that way,” says Mario Canseco with Insights West.
“It’s a similar issue with the alcohol taxes. Maybe you don’t like scotch, but if somebody’s paying… to get some of that tax revenue, it makes sense. I think this is one of the reasons for the support.”
The Liberals and Green Party back legalization and the NDP supports decriminalization, while the Conservatives want to keep pot illegal.
